LESSON.HEADINGS: <1>First an exercise to warm up.</1> <2>These sentences use all the letters in the alphabet.</2> <3>So do these... such sentences are pangrams.</3> <4>And one more set of pangrams!</4>
LESSON.DESCRIPTION: The eleventh lesson will let you practice sentences with most of the letters of the alphabet in them.

TASK.TEXT: aqaz swsx dedc frfv gtgb ;p;/ lol. kik, jujm hyhn aqaz
The quick brown fox jumped over the lazy dogs. Now it's
time for all good men to come to the aid of the party.
The five boxing wizards jump quickly.
We judged antique ivory buckles for the next prize.
Jaded zombies acted quaintly but kept driving their oxen.
A jar of oil mixed with zinc oxide makes a bright paint.
How razorback-jumping frogs can level piqued gymnasts!
Pack my box with five dozen liquor jugs.
Sphinx of black quartz, judge my vow.
Waltz, nymph, for quick jigs vex Bud.
Six juicy steaks sizzled as five workmen left the quarry.
While making excavations we found some quaint jewelry.
We promptly judged antique ivory buckles for the prize.
Crazy Fredericka bought many very exquisite opal jewels.
